content.text:
# List of international presidential trips made by Aníbal Cavaco Silva

|term_end =
|predecessor = Jorge Sampaio
|successor = Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa
|website =
}}
Below is a list of international presidential trips made by Aníbal Cavaco Silva as President of the Portuguese Republic.
2006
{| class="wikitable"
!Country
!Locations
!Date
!Details
|-
|
|Bissau
|July
|6th CPLP Summit.
|-
|
|Madrid
|25-28 September
|Visit to his Spanish counterpart King Juan Carlos I and his wife, Queen Sofía.
|-
|
|Montevideo
|November
|16th Ibero-American Summit.
|}
2007
{| class="wikitable"
!Country
!Locations
!Date

|
|10-28 January

|-
|
|
|9 March
|
|-
|
|Riga
|April
|4th Arraiolos meeting
|-
|
|
|20-23 June
|During this visit, President Cavaco Silva plans to open an exhibition concerning Portugal's role in the discovery and convergence of diverse cultures, and to contact some Portuguese communities on the North American Eastern Seaboard, including the city of Fall River, Massachusetts whose Portuguese-descended population (43.9 percent at the 2000 census) is the highest of any municipality in the United States. Fall River features a replica of "The Gates of the City of Ponta Delgada" or "Portas da Cidade" in Portuguese.
|-
|
|European institutions in
Strasbourg and Brussels
|3-5 September
|
|-
|
|Santiago
|6-10 November
|Meeting with President Michelle Bachelet. 17th Ibero-American Summit.
|}

|
|
|-
|
|
|5-7 March
|
|-
|
|
|14-17 April
|Meeting with President Václav Klaus. The trip had to be extended due to the air traffic disruptions because of the eruption(s) of Eyjafjallajökull.
|-
|
|
|4-7 July
|Meeting with his counterpart of Cape Verde, President Pedro Pires. Cavaco Silva also met with the Prime Minister of Cape Verde.
|-
|
|
|18-23 July
|Silva made a strong effort to speak to business owners and to strengthen relations between Portuguese and Angolan businesses. met with the President Eduardo dos Santos along with many of the governors of the different regions of Angola. This trip is expected to be the last state visit that Cavaco Silva will make during his first term of the presidency. 8th CPLP Summit (23 July).
|-
|
|Mar del Plata
|November
|20th Ibero-American Summit.
|}
